required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Nivolumab in Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory Follicular Lymphoma (FL) (CheckMate 140)
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Arm, Open-Label Phase 2 Study of Nivolumab (BMS-936558) in Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory Follicular Lymphoma (FL)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the clinical benefit of Nivolumab, as measured by independent radiologic review committee (IRRC)-assessed objective response rate (ORR) in subjects with FL lymphoma who have failed therapy with both CD20 antibody and an alkylating agent.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) as Determined by IRRC
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)
primary_outcome.description: ORR is determined by an independent radiologic review committee (IRRC) according to the revised International Working Group Criteria for non-Hodgkin Lymphoma. ORR is defined as the number of subjects with a best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) and expressed as a percentage of all treated participants. CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of spleen, liver, and bone marrow involvement. PR=Regression of measurable disease and no new sites; no increase in size of liver or spleen. >=50% decrease in SPD of up to 6 largest dominant masses (index lesions); no increase in size of other nodes (non-index lesions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DOR) Based on IRRC Assessments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)
secondary_outcome.description: DOR is defined as the time from first remission (CR or PR) to the date of initial objectively documented progression as determined using the revised International Working Group Criteria for non-Hodgkin Lymphoma, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. CR definition includes the complete disappearance of all evidence of disease, the definition of PR includes at least a 50% decrease in sum of the product of the diameters (SPD) of up to six of the largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, and PD is defined as any new lesion or increase by >50% of previously involved sites from nadir, as described in the IWG response criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete Remission Rate (CRR) Based on IRRC Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)
secondary_outcome.description: CRR is defined as the number of subjects with a BOR of CR according to the revised International Working Group Criteria for non-Hodgkin Lymphoma, divided by the number of treated participants and expressed as a percentage. CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of spleen, liver, and bone marrow involvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Partial Remission (PR) Rate Based on IRRC Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PR rate is defined as the number of participants with a best overall response (BOR) of PR according to the 2007 International Working Group (IWG) criteria, based on IRRC assessment, divided by the number of treated participants and expressed as a percentage. PR=Regression of measurable disease and no new sites; no increase in size of liver or spleen. >=50% decrease in SPD of up to 6 largest dominant masses (index lesions); no increase in size of other nodes (non-index lesions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) Based on IRRC Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was summarized descriptively using the Kaplan-Meier (KM) product-limit method. Median values of PFS, along with the two-sided 95% CIs were calculated using a method based on log-log transformation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) Based on Investigator Assessments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is determined by investigator assessments according to the revised International Working Group Criteria for non-Hodgkin Lymphoma. ORR is defined as the number of subjects with a best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) and is expressed as a percentage of all treated participants. CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of spleen, liver, and bone marrow involvement. PR=Regression of measurable disease and no new sites; no increase in size of liver or spleen. >=50% decrease in SPD of up to 6 largest dominant masses (index lesions); no increase in size of other nodes (non-index lesions)

arm_group.description: Nivolumab 3 mg/kg injection by Intravenous for every 2 weeks until disease progression or discontinuation due to toxicity

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Grade 1, 2, or 3a FL without pathologic evidence of transformation
- Male and female, ages 18 and above, with relapsed or refractory FL lymphoma after > or =2 prior treatment lines; each of the 2 prior treatment lines must include at least CD20 antibody and/or an alkylating agent
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status (PS) 0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known central nervous system lymphoma
- History of interstitial lung disease
- Subjects with active, known or suspected autoimmune disease
- Prior allogeneic stem cell transplant
- Prior autologous stem cell transplant â‰¤12 weeks prior to first dose of study drug

facility.name: Division Of Hematology & Oncology Ctr. For Health Sciences
CISSS du Bas-Saint-Laurent Hopital Regional de Rimouski

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 116 participants were enrolled; 92 received study treatment. Participants were enrolled but not treated because they no longer met study criteria (n=20), withdrew consent (n=1), or for other reasons (n=3).

group.title: Arm 1: Nivolumab
group.description: Nivolumab 3mg/kg intravenously every 2 weeks until disease progression or discontinuation due to toxicity

outcome.title: Overall Response Rate (ORR) as Determined by IRRC
outcome.description: ORR is determined by an independent radiologic review committee (IRRC) according to the revised International Working Group Criteria for non-Hodgkin Lymphoma. ORR is defined as the number of subjects with a best overall response (BOR) of complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) and expressed as a percentage of all treated participants. CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of spleen, liver, and bone marrow involvement. PR=Regression of measurable disease and no new sites; no increase in size of liver or spleen. >=50% decrease in SPD of up to 6 largest dominant masses (index lesions); no increase in size of other nodes (non-index lesions)
outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)

measure.title: Complete Remission Rate (CRR) Based on IRRC Assessment
measure.description: CRR is defined as the number of subjects with a BOR of CR according to the revised International Working Group Criteria for non-Hodgkin Lymphoma, divided by the number of treated participants and expressed as a percentage. CR=Disappearance of all clinical/radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes to normal size, absence of spleen, liver, and bone marrow involvement.

outcome.title: Partial Remission (PR) Rate Based on IRRC Assessment
outcome.description: PR rate is defined as the number of participants with a best overall response (BOR) of PR according to the 2007 International Working Group (IWG) criteria, based on IRRC assessment, divided by the number of treated participants and expressed as a percentage. PR=Regression of measurable disease and no new sites; no increase in size of liver or spleen. >=50% decrease in SPD of up to 6 largest dominant masses (index lesions); no increase in size of other nodes (non-index lesions)
outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)

group.title: Arm 1: Nivolumab

measure.title: Partial Remission (PR) Rate Based on IRRC Assessment
measure.description: PR rate is defined as the number of participants with a best overall response (BOR) of PR according to the 2007 International Working Group (IWG) criteria, based on IRRC assessment, divided by the number of treated participants and expressed as a percentage. PR=Regression of measurable disease and no new sites; no increase in size of liver or spleen. >=50% decrease in SPD of up to 6 largest dominant masses (index lesions); no increase in size of other nodes (non-index lesions)

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS) Based on IRRC Assessment
outcome.description: PFS was summarized descriptively using the Kaplan-Meier (KM) product-limit method. Median values of PFS, along with the two-sided 95% CIs were calculated using a method based on log-log transformation.
outcome.time_frame: From Week 9 until documented disease progression or study discontinuation (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)

reported_events.time_frame: From screening to last dose plus 100 days (assessed up to June 2017, approximately 38 months)

group.title: Nivolumab 3 mg/kg

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period â‰¤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
